column4: anyone know why I need ot restart ubuntu 9.10 machine three or four times to get graphics to work?

from previous expierance, if multiple reboots are need to make anything electronic start up correctly , it isnt the configurations or the os or anything like that, its the hardware, but, i suppose just for arguments sake that if u reboot a million times it might reboot differantly one of those times
Only started doing this when I upgraded from 9.04 to 9.10 last night.
are u using options when you restart?
No, nothing fancy.
ascavasion anything at all?
Nothing... default start up.
ascavasion, that dosent make any sense 2 me, but i am a noob to linux/ubuntu so i suppose theres something i dont know about rebooting over and over again
Me neither... I think the Karmic upgrade was a screw up.

ascavasion it could be only coincidental, i had this happen with a mouse the other day, i installed ubuntu studio and all of a sudden my mmb did not rotate the view in blender or seem 2 work at all, it turned out the mouse was faulty, i checked it in a diff sys n it did the same thing
Ascavasion try this, in power options theres an option to let the monitor sleep, set the time to like 1 min and let it fully sleep and see if it comes back on
Where is that?
ascavasion system, power managment
oops system, PREFS, power managment
It never did anything.
Ascavasion hmm this just makes no sense 2 me, try re-asking/stating your issue, maybe someone else knows whats going on
Okay, the screen came back just fine.
sigh... how come every time I upgrade Ubuntu everything goes haywire?

Ascavasion, umm, u can try putting it to sleep, hibernate, do anything to get the monitor/graphics card 2 shut off w/0 actually shutting down the sys. try a few diff things a few times and see if the monitor turns on every time
ascavasion if in fact the monitor turns back on every time, it just may be some kind of bug that shows up durring boot up
I did the suspend thing
